Primary Reading Terminal: Feline Macro Prospectus

Caretaker-grade wealth guidance, translated in full-body motion.

Moonwhisker Treasury Library advises households, clubs, and corner bakeries on balanced digital asset stewardship through a choreographic briefing model. Your lead advisor performs market position, risk appetite, and treasury direction in a sequence of cataloged gestures; each motion maps to a published glossary in our Reading Annex.

Our flagship instrument, Pirouette Ledger Unit (PLU), is the cooperative reserve coin used for long-horizon household liquidity. Subscription and retainers are settled in soup, transferred in sealed portions and documented against your account folio.

Dance-to-decision protocol: Revision 5.4 Soup clearing windows: Tue/Fri 07:00-11:00 Custody model: Cozy + Auditable

Current brief format

Morning sequence begins with two clockwise paw arcs, signaling conservative entry allocation. Shoulder dip equals low-leverage stance. Tail sweep concludes with treasury hold recommendation.

Suitable for members who track volatility by the hour and prefer immediate choreography notes before opening bell.

Stacks Bulletin Board

Research notes from this fortnight

The Quiet Utility Thesis for PLU in Neighborhood Treasuries

Our analysts reviewed 41 small-organization cash logs and found that choreography-first advisories reduced panic reallocation during high-noise weeks. Soup-denominated billing also improved expense discipline because teams can physically see outflow in pantry terms.

Reading note: prioritize liquidity routines over headline momentum, especially when broth futures spike near holiday kitchens.

Dance Lexicon Update 2.1

Added three new gestures: the Lantern Pivot (yield caution), the Archive Step (steady accumulation), and the Balcony Reach (temporary hedge posture). All gestures now include left- and right-paw variants for accessibility.

Community Notice

The Reading Annex now hosts monthly quiet hours for first-time coin members. Bring your portfolio notebook and one labeled soup container per participant for onboarding credit.
